image.altText: Hands holding phones at a social media summit.

props.synopsis: Government leaders, academics, advocates and teenagers met over two days to discuss the impact of social media and how to handle its effects in the future.

title.children: Two states came together to talk about how social media is impacting young people. Here's how it happened.

image.altText: A man with grey hair and beard leans over bushfire bunker built into ground

props.synopsis: Adelaide Hills father Daniel Katz admits he did not go through the proper channels when building a bushfire bunker at his family home, but now fears he will be forbidden from using the structure even as a last resort.

title.children: Hills resident battling for bushfire bunker approval fears he'll be 'forced to remove' shelter

image.altText: An elderly lady with shoulder length blonde hair and black glasses stares at the camera over her left shoulder

props.synopsis: Grieving mother Jan Edwards was heartbroken when a legal "loophole" stopped her speaking in court after her son was fatally run over by a car. It sparked a fight for change that has reached parliament.

title.children: Grief-stricken mum denied the chance to read victim impact statement takes her fight to parliament

image.altText: A woman with dark hair up in braids smiles

props.synopsis: After waking from a week-long coma caused by a cardiac arrest that left her with a hypoxic brain injury, Mel Hartman was so disoriented she thought she "was still a rowdy teenager" â€” and while she has undergone intensive rehabilitation, she says social supports are lacking.

title.children: When Mel Hartman awoke from a coma at 31, she thought she was a 'rowdy teenager'

image.altText: A bearded ranger leans over a map wearing sunglasses, it is a bright sunny day.

props.synopsis: In an age where the smart phone has become the go-to for many of our navigational needs, there are still those who rely on physical maps.

title.children: Paper maps were once the stuff of treasure hunts for Owen, but now they're a big part of his job

image.altText: A man pauses for a portrait in front of a map

props.synopsis: The few people remaining in Lebanon's south make the same dire prediction about Israel's bombardment and ground offensive against the militant group Hezbollah.

title.children: 'Same scenario as in Gaza': Lebanese mayor fears he's seen his town's future

image.altText: People in Hazmat suits walk out of a door way, red paint can be seen on the wall.

props.synopsis: Peter Khalil's electorate office has been doused with an unknown substance, in what the government's special envoy for social cohesion has called an "escalation" of previous incidents.

title.children: 'It smells like an abattoir': Labor MP's electorate office sprayed with red paint and unknown substances

image.altText: An audience of hundreds of people in front of a stage with shining lights and two screens.

props.synopsis: Inside a Ticketmaster transaction, there are hidden and public fees that are filtered back to parent company Live Nation. But how much is really being charged, and for what?

title.children: 'Where's this money going?': Breaking down the global behemoth taking over Aussie music

image.altText: A military helicopter takes off behind a solder at nights

props.synopsis: Israel's military says a Hezbollah drone killed four soldiers at one of its northern bases, as it expanded its bombardments of Lebanon and troops battled militants across the border.

title.children: Hezbollah drone attack kills four Israeli soldiers as IDF criticised for entering UN base in Lebanon

image.altText: Woman with blonde and black sweater stands on busy street at night, the background action blurred

props.synopsis: Someone spent years plastering deepfake porn of Hannah Grundy online. It was a betrayal that turned her life upside down.

title.children: Hannah found deepfake porn of herself online. The culprit was closer to home than she realised

image.altText: A white house made of recycled materials with a blue sky behind it.

props.synopsis: Bespoke eco-friendly stays have popped up right across regional South Australia. Industry bodies say they are vital for reinvigorating the tourism industry after a drop in visitor numbers.

title.children: Why eco-stays might be the key to boosting regional tourism amid post-COVID dip

image.altText: Burney wears a traditional possum skin cloak, standing on the lower house floor.

props.synopsis: On the first anniversary of the failed Voice referendum, Linda Burney â€” the minister responsible for delivering the vote â€” wants to set the record straight.

title.children: Linda Burney on why the Voice vote went ahead even as support crumbled

image.altText: A large construction fence in front of a large empty grass block of land on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Complex state planning laws and allegations that Woolworths and Coles are hoarding blocks of land to keep competitors out are facing further scrutiny from the ACCC as it investigates the country's concentrated supermarket sector.

title.children: Locals have little choice where to shop in a town that's home to one of Woolworths' 110 empty blocks of land

image.altText: A woman's hands hold a human skull.

props.synopsis: Laws banning the sale of human bones need to be reviewed to close "loopholes", legal experts say, amid a police probe into an auction house accused of selling skeletal remains.

title.children: Calls for crackdown on 'commodification of the dead'

image.altText: A large passenger bus is surrounded by police vehicles and a fire truck.

props.synopsis: Police say an intoxicated man entered a chartered coach loaded with passengers in Adelaide this morning and attempted to drive it away.

title.children: Four officers, police dog allegedly assaulted by man who boarded charter bus

image.altText: A man wearing a hat and glasses looks at a grapevine.

props.synopsis: Farmers in Australia's largest wine grape growing region are still counting losses from severe frost last month and there is no help on the horizon.

title.children: South Australian wine growers plead for help as frost 'disaster' hits 80 per cent of grapes

image.altText: Smoke is emitted from a large silver cylinder as it hangs from two large metal prongs on a launch tower.

props.synopsis: SpaceX pulled off its boldest test flight yet of the enormous Starship rocket on Sunday, catching the returning booster back at the launch pad using a tower dubbed "Mechazilla".

title.children: In engineering feat, SpaceX's mechanical 'arms' successfully catch Starship rocket booster back at launch pad

image.altText: old photo of young girl with older ladies projected onto large white silos with purple night sky and stars in background

props.synopsis: Decades after their last visit, three siblings have come back to the tiny wheatbelt town of their childhoods, with a projector in tow and a plan to wow their former community.

title.children: 'City slickers' welcomed by country town in 1968 return with an epic silo slide show

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court is hearing arguments over whether Mr Lehrmann's appeal against the ruling in his failed defamation case should go ahead.

title.children: Bruce Lehmann's lawyer accuses Network Ten of bullying in Federal Court appeal hearing

image.altText: A picture of Andrew Truman in a suit on a staircase.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of Andrew Truman have paid tribute to the 44-year-old who died after an alleged assault in Melbourne's CBD last week. Police are still searching for a man over the incident.

title.children: Family in shock over CBD assault death of 'vibrant' Melbourne man

image.altText: Anthony Albanese frowns during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Rather than a National Apology-style watershed moment, today's anniversary of the failed Voice to Parliament referendum is one that many Indigenous people and the more than 6 million who voted Yes want to forget.

title.children: Voters are inclined to give governments second terms. If they don't, the Voice will be top of the reasons why

image.altText: Donald Trump waves to a crowd wearing a red Make America Great Again hat.

props.synopsis: Police reveal they arrested a man with multiple weapons outside a Donald Trump rally on Saturday, local time.

title.children: Man arrested with weapons at Trump rally named as local police say he posed as a journalist

image.altText: A nurse standing in a hospital hallway pulls off her shower cap while dressed in full PPE

props.synopsis: Thousands of patients caught COVID in NSW public hospitals last year and hundreds died, fuelling concerns among infection control experts that hospitals are not taking strong enough precautions against airborne viruses.

title.children: Thousands caught COVID in NSW hospitals last year, hundreds died, new data shows

image.altText: Members of the Rebels motorcycle club

props.synopsis: Digital technology is changing how the underworld operates. According to a senior policeman, it's leading to younger crews with less experience stepping up and performing serious crimes and putting the public at risk.

title.children: The way killing is undertaken in Australia's underworld is changing

image.altText: A woman holds her palm to her forehead as she stands in a corridor, silhouetted.

props.synopsis: Some university students studying secondary teaching say the violent and sexist behaviour they have witnessed during school placements has made them want to drop out of their degrees.

title.children: Future teacher 'filled with terror' and wanting to drop out after secondary school placements

image.altText: A man standing at the side of a football oval

props.synopsis: Victorians abused in foster care have called a $20,000 compensation payment offered by the state government insufficient and unfair.

title.children: Victorians abused in foster care say state government compensation is insulting

image.altText: Dan Houston of Port Adelaide celebrates with fans, walking around the ground shaking hands

props.synopsis: A pick swap from last week has Carlton once again in the hunt for Dan Houston. Meanwhile, Hawthorn is under fire for placing its deal for Tom Barrass in jeopardy. Follow live.

title.children: Carlton given fresh hope in Dan Houston chase as legend whacks Hawks over 'bonehead' trade call

image.altText: Two men in blue suits stand in front of a podium, one of them holds a brochure that reads 'Tasmanian budget 2024 - 2025'

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff throws his full support behind his embattled deputy at a press conference in Launceston on Monday.

title.children: Tasmanian Premier says deputy Michael Ferguson has his 'full confidence' ahead of expected no-confidence motion

image.altText: a collage of two premiers, a former female premier on the left and a current male on the right

props.synopsis: Former Queensland premier Peter Beattie is saying out loud what is plainly obvious: Steven Miles had a very small runway in the lead up to this election.

title.children: Labor heavyweight says Annastacia Palaszczuk left Steven Miles with a tough task

image.altText: Close up of red and green numbers on ASX board

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is on the rise despite a lack of detail in the latest Chinese stimulus package over the weekend. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX on the rise despite disappointing news from China

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 up 0.3%, Web Travel crashes on profit warning

image.altText: Dozens of hens with glossy brown feathers and red plump combs under a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: Biosecurity, environmental funding for protected native species and a top-up of the national stockpile of flu vaccines are part of preparations for the arrival of H5N1 to Australia.

title.children: Federal government sets out $95 million to combat potential arrival of deadly bird flu strain H5N1

image.altText: An American saltwater crocodile opens its mouth underwater.

props.synopsis: Crocodiles are on the move across Queensland and there is concern people are putting themselves in mortal danger.

title.children: Authorities work to debunk myths amid crackdown on reckless behaviour around crocodiles
